segments.en: Linked Discourses 55
3. About Sarakāni
22. With Mahānāma (2nd)
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “idaṃ, bhante, kapilavatthu iddhañceva phītañca bāhujaññaṃ ākiṇṇamanussaṃ sambādhabyūhaṃ.
segments.en: “Sir, this Kapilavatthu is successful and prosperous and full of people, with cramped cul-de-sacs.

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ vā payirupāsitvā manobhāvanīye vā bhikkhū sāyanhasamayaṃ kapilavatthuṃ pavisanto;
segments.en: In the late afternoon, after paying homage to the Buddha or an esteemed mendicant, I enter Kapilavatthu.
I encounter a stray elephant,
horse,
chariot,
cart,
or person.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, tasmiṃ samaye mussateva bhagavantaṃ ārabbha sati, mussati dhammaṃ ārabbha sati, mussati saṅghaṃ ārabbha sati.
segments.en: At that time I lose mindfulness regarding the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
I think:

segments.pli: ‘imamhi cāhaṃ samaye kālaṃ kareyyaṃ, kā mayhaṃ gati, ko abhisamparāyo’”ti?
segments.en: ‘If I were to die at this time, where would I be reborn in my next life?’”
“Do not fear, Mahānāma, do not fear!

segments.pli: Apāpakaṃ te maraṇaṃ bhavissati apāpikā kālaṅkiriyā.
segments.en: Your death will not be a bad one; your passing will not be a bad one.

segments.pli: Catūhi kho, mahānāma, dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro.
segments.en: A noble disciple who has four things slants, slopes, and inclines towards extinguishment.
What four?

segments.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, mahānāma, rukkho pācīnaninno pācīnapoṇo pācīnapabbhāro, so mūlacchinno katamena papateyyā”ti?
segments.en: Suppose there was a tree that slants, slopes, and inclines to the east. If it was cut off at the root where would it fall?”

segments.pli: “Yena, bhante, ninno yena poṇo yena pabbhāro”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, it would fall in the direction that it slants, slopes, and inclines.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, mahānāma, imehi catūhi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro”ti.
segments.en: “In the same way, a noble disciple who has four things slants, slopes, and inclines towards extinguishment.”

suttaplex.blurb: Mahānāma the Sakyan expresses his fear that if he dies unmindful he may go to a bad rebirth. The Buddha tells him not to fear, as he will definitely go to a good place, since he has the four factors of stream-entry.
